author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1705776264}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand—the hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed—the hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥ minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198172925593', 'num_games_owned': 14023, 'num_reviews': 4533, 'playtime_forever': 257, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 257, 'last_played': 1574603209}
review:
一款横版动作游戏
游戏里控制的主角可以绳索用来攻击、移动
但是攻击的神索只能垂直向上或者向下，而无法攻击前后方的敌人
过了几关后还能学会抓钩，可以勾住场景里固定的摆荡点，以达到普通跳跃无法来到的地点
后期还会有前后场景切换的传送点、减少摩擦力的冰雪场地、以及类似于切换重力的能力等等
游戏整体难度不算高，即使死了也能在存档点立刻复活，死掉的怪物却不会刷新，算是相当友善的关卡设置了

author: {'steamid': '76561198261957551', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 255, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1544351123}
review:
I don't quite understand why you'd want to play this game when [url=https://store.steampowered.com/app/350740/The_Bug_Butcher/]Bug Butcher[/url] does the same thing, has a much more polished UI, costs the same price and doesn't require useless and clunky platforming.

[edit: Fixed the Bug Butcher URL]

At nearly $10, this game is way overpriced. It's more like a choppy android game that someone developer pooped out over a weekend than a real game. Just look at the UI graphics and tell me it doesn't immediately come off as a default stock option from some dime-a-dozen "build a game" program. The developer does seem to try, but their efforts are put in the wrong place, because the "main menu" is just straight up clunky and drives home the point of "just because you can, doesn't mean you should". The game sets a very poor first impression, and it only goes downhill from there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030516476', 'num_games_owned': 5534, 'num_reviews': 465, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1540898784}
review:
J'ai beaucoup de mal avec ce genre de petits jeux de plateforme qui souvent prennent le dessus et me tapent sur le nerfs, je finis toujours par les laisser trainer dans un coin pour ne plus jamais y revenir.

Mais pourtant ici même si il y a un certain challenge, j'y ai pris énormément de plaisir et je l'ai terminé jusqu'au bout !!! 
Il n'est pas différent des autres question frustration, j'ai recommencé plus d'une fois certains niveaux, mais il m'a rappelé tellement de souvenirs avec son mélange de graphismes d'antan aux allures d'un super mario et au gameplay d'un pang j'ai adoré.

J'ai ragé à quelques mètres juste avant la fin du niveau quand je me suis glitché dans un des murs du haut en jouant à Tarzan :

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1549412399


J'ai ragé sur la hit box qui déconne parfois, mais ce jeu est une perle pour celles et ceux aimant les jeux d'arcade oldschool, il ne révolutionne certes pas le monde du jeu vidéo, mais reste très addictif et très plaisant et on fera fi de ses petits défauts. 

J'ai bien aimé son gameplay : me balancer à l'aide du grappin même si parfois celui-ci n'accrochais pas comme je le voulais là où il faut - en même temps je ne suis pas une as de ce genre de jeux - puis me propulser dans les airs pour m'aggriper tel un aimant sur les parois en hauteur,  et son monde paralèlle auquel on accède grace aux téléporteurs, mais surtout trucider les bouboules qui se divisent et subdivisent encore façon Pang.

Le seul bémol est l'histoire et la cinématique entre les niveaux, j'ai du zapper car les textes défilent trop vite, on n'a pas le temps de lire et du coup on laisse tomber ce qui se dit en terme d'histoire de fond.

quelques petites illustrations en images : 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1549411156

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1549410915

Franchement je n'en attendais rien d'exceptionnel, et finalement j'ai beaucoup aimé.


[code][h1][b]Si vous avez apprécié cette évaluation et souhaitez en lire d'autres venez suivre ma [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39072619/]page de curation[/url].[/b][/h1][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198136373263', 'num_games_owned': 1352, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1525497681}
review: This game is a real ball buster! I really am a sucker for these type of games, brings me back to my days of playing the Buster Bros. collection on playstation with some light-platforming thrown in. I definitely appreciate additions to the game like the grappling hook, the game could benefit from an endless mode or co-op but pick it up if you see it on sale (i got my copy in the Lazy Guys Discovery Bundle)

author: {'steamid': '76561198085062858', 'num_games_owned': 136, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 283, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 283, 'last_played': 1515747316}
review:
Really nice game, with the right level of difficulty in my opinion! The atmosphere and the musics are great, and the general principle of destroying the spheroids, as old as it is, stays fun throughout the whole game! 
Only thing that could be improved in my opinion: the texts with the scientists go way too fast to be read, maybe could it be a bit slowed down?

author: {'steamid': '76561198278001164', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1499201062}
review:
ASPECTOS POSITIVOS:

*Muy buena banda sonora.

*Control preciso.

*Buena combinación de diversos estilos de juego, como Super Pang, Gravity Island / Gravity Cat y Mutant Mudds.


ASPECTOS NEGATIVOS:

*Si mueres los enemigos ya eliminados no vuelven a aparecer, por lo que no representa un desafío, pues es posible morir las veces que sea para superar una etapa.

* Muchos bugs en el juego, a veces se pueden aprovechar y a veces no, se debe tener cuidado ya que si se hace uno mal se debe reiniciar la partida por completo.

*El final es horrible, te toma desprevenido, es que esperas más y nada más no, ya ha terminado, un buen boss al cual atacar no caería nada mal.
